The Role:At JoeScan, we're a small team revolutionizing the lumber industry by enhancing precision and efficiency in sawmill operations. Our mission? To empower sawmills with cutting-edge vision technology that identifies defects in lumber at unparalleled speeds. Your challenge, should you choose to accept it, involves crafting and refining machine learning models capable of detecting the slightest imperfections in lumber as it hurtles towards its destiny. The stakes are high, and the pace is relentless. Can your algorithms enhance our vision and keep us at the forefront of sawmill technology?This is an opportunity to make a difference. Sawmills throughout the world will depend on the technology you develop to get the most from our forests. What it takesFit:You take ownership of your day to day tasks and actively shape your role within the framework of your team and its vision of success. You don’t need a to-do list handed to you to get things done.You're a team player, eager to contribute across multiple domains and thrive in a collaborative environment.You possess a keen ability to tackle complex, sometimes ambiguous problems with strategic thinking and creativity.You're a fast learner, ready to dive deep into the lumber industry, understanding the machinery, processes, and people that make it tick. You aren’t afraid to get your boots dirty.Excellent communication skills are second nature to you, facilitating clear and direct interactions both within the team and with our partners.Skills:You are proficient in developing and implementing machine learning models, particularly focused on real-time computer vision tasks.You have solid experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and understanding of neural network architectures.You can demonstrate knowledge in processing and analyzing image data to identify patterns and anomalies.You can integrate ML models into existing systems, optimizing for performance and scalability.You possess strong programming skills in Python, Julia, C++, or relevant languages for machine learning and data processing.You also have deep experience with dataset preparation, augmentation, and validation to ensure model accuracy and reliability.You are familiar with agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.Bonus Points:Experience in the lumber industry or similar domains where vision technology is applied.Experience using projective geometry and 3D machine vision techniquesContributions to open-source projects or publications in relevant fields.Familiarity with edge computing and deploying models on low-power, high-performance hardware.Speaking a foreign languageQualifications:A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with a focus on machine learning or computer vision.3+ years of experience in designing, training, and implementing machine learning models, with a portfolio that showcases your work in vision-based projects.How to applyPlease send resumes to jobs@joescan.com. In the body of your email, briefly share with us your most impactful project in machine learning or computer vision and why it stands out to you.To ensure you've read this listing thoroughly, please include your favorite sci-fi character in the subject line of your application email.Base Salary Range: $120K to $200K, depending on experience.Benefits:100% Paid Single/Family Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance100% Paid $50,000 Life Insurance Policy100% Paid Short Term & Long Term Disability Insurance100% Paid WA PFML100% Paid WA Workmans Comp Insurance401k Safe Harbor & Profit ShareGenerous vacation and flex time policies.JoeScan provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Intel Corporation, MSO-Global Sourcing for Equipment Materials (GSEM) organization Is looking for a Data Analytics/Operations intern, this internship will start mid-May, 2024.As a member of the team, you will be a full business partner making and influencing business decisions that optimize Intel's Supply Chain.The Supply Chain Intern Program includes practical training and educational events, networking/social opportunities, and exposure to senior leadership and the Supply Chain Community.The actual scope will depend on business need/project, but examples include:Develop new processes and procedures to enhance operations, create new tools, systems or calculators, develop PowerBI reports and dashboards, etc.Converting business requirements into actionable strategies and tactics as they relate to creating/managing new automated work flowsPartner to develop cost models and drive cost savings initiatives in support of the business strategy through analytics and engagement with customers across the supply chainConducting benchmarking or market analysis to develop recommendations based on industry best practicesIdentifying and implementing improvements of processes, systems, and tools based a thorough understanding of the business processes and supply chain dependenciesUsing data analytics and visualization tools to drive tactical and strategic decision processes.Working with cross-organizational teams to solve problems and drive supply chain solutions via automation/AIThe ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Problem-solving skills; Analytical skills; Working in a dynamic, results and team-oriented environment; High tolerance for ambiguity; Strong written and verbal communication skills; Influence, strategic thinking, and leadership skills.‍Qualifications‍You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through schoolwork, classes and project work, internships, military training, and/or work experience.Minimum Qualifications:The candidate must be currently pursuing a Masters of Data Analytics, Finance, Supply Chain or related field of study.Candidate must have an automation mindset and must have 6+ months of educational or work experience with the following: Business intelligence and data visualization tools (such as Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate, other low-code applications, tools, etc.) Experience with managing datasets and performing data analysisBasic Financial / Business Acumen  Willing to do a 3-month internship with potential to extend through fall/spring.Preferred Qualifications:Supply chain knowledge is a plusSharePointAgile methodologies and leverage and deploy AI toolThis position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship.  Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related  job experience.  This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience.‍

At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.About the TeamWorkmates pride themselves on winning while having fun! That means supporting each other while driving accountability for amazing results and performance. This team is no different. Everything we do inspires a brighter work day for all. The Specialized Sales team at Workday helps the company to continue to grow by balancing integrity and innovation, ensuring Workmates have the environment to bring their best self, and get better by pushing and developing themselves and the Workmates around them.About the RoleHere at Workday, our Specialized Account Executives are key players in our Field Sales organization. With a net new revenue focus, they are the fuel for Workday’s new customer growth of Workday Specialized Products (e.g., Adaptive Planning, Scout, and Peakon today). This fantastic team of hardworking professionals play a key role in guiding new customers on a journey that can see them leave the limitations of legacy platforms behind and move forward with a new class of enterprise management cloud. In this role, you will:•Develop and drive the overall short-term strategy for the account, aligned to customer business objectives and builds & maintain long-term relationships•Be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with customers and channel partners with a focus on deal management and connecting customer needs with specific specialized products Workday solutions•Work with Net New AEs to identify potential Workday solution sales for existing specialized products customers•Maintain accurate and timely customer/prospect, pipeline, and service forecast dataAbout YouBasic Qualifications•~8+ years of experience selling SaaS/Cloud based solutions to C-levels in a field sales position.•Experience of managing 2-3 month sales cycles, including prospecting for a portion of opportunities•Experience developing deep product expertise on new products and stays up to date with industry trends•Experience with account planning and coordinating with internal stakeholders to create alignmentOther Qualifications•Understanding of the strategic competitive landscape of the industry by staying up to date with trends and customer needs so you can effectively position Workday solutions within accounts•Experience developing deep product expertise on new products and stays up to date with industry trends•Experience partnering with internal team members on account strategies for prospecting activities and territory management•Excellent verbal and written communication skills

post_title: Senior Software Development Engineer for Machine Learning
details: At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.About the TeamThe Workday Education team’s primary purpose is to build an exceptional student and instructor experience by delivering engaging and innovative learning solutions to help customers, partners, and employees make the most of the Workday unified system.Interested in learning more? Please visit http://joinworkdayeducation.com.About the RoleAre you passionate about quality content? On the Education Content QA and Language Services team, we actively identify and drive improvements in our training. We strive to meet the needs of our global audience as we build the future of learning at Workday. We advocate for all learners by implementing accessibility and inclusive language standards. And we develop internal training to achieve individual and team development goals. Join us as we help Workday Education build engaging content for our learners!The Translations Reviewer role reviews translated content in Japanese to ensure an outstanding experience for our global learners. Your primary responsibility will be editing Japanese learning content, including course manuals, video scripts, and presentation decks. You will also work with our localization team and language managers to incorporate feedback from customers and internal partners to improve the quality of our translated content, as well as develop and maintain a Japanese-specific style guide.(Note: You must have advanced proficiency in both English and Japanese. Preference will be given to a native Japanese speaker.)About YouYou are a confident editor with excellent language skills and experience with the nuances of localization. If your passion for quality means you identify content, design, and translation issues before readers do, you're a fit for content QA!Basic Qualifications3+ years of experience editing translated content for accuracy, clarity, and adherence to style guides.Business-level fluency with technical vocabulary in English and Japanese.Experience providing constructive feedback to writers and translators.Ability to work well with a remote team.Other QualificationsTechnical background or knowledge of Workday products.Working proficiency in Google Docs and Sheets.Experience with content management systems, translations management systems, and computer-assisted translation (CAT) tools.Familiarity with instructional design principles.Fluency in French is a plus.‍

and online platformsAct as a liaison between developers and internal teams, representing the product to gain adoption of newly released technologyContent CreationDevelop high-quality technical You will join Enterprise Systems and Experience (ESE) which is part of Autodesk’s 3500+ person Digital Platform & Experience division. ESE is the crew that helps Autodesk deliver employee productivity. We are all about improving the productivity of our people across the organization.    As the Collaboration Systems Engineer you will manage the administration, and integration of our collaboration platforms at Autodesk. You will work with internal and external partners across diverse organizations. You will be a part of setting and maintaining standards, best practices, reviewing procedures, and ensuring success and security at Autodesk. You will automate business processes as an essential part of the role. You will participate in the technical design of the platforms, and ongoing feature changes and maintenance.   You will work with diverse personas across Autodesk including senior leadership, partners, and technology staff. Your success requires establishing working relationships with our users to ensure efficient, secure, and practical solutions to deliver engaging productivity experiences. You will report to the Collaboration Services Engineering Manager.Responsibilities    Maintain performance and availability of collaboration systems, including regular preventive and corrective maintenance, capacity planning, and scalability managementRecord changes, configurations, incidents, problems, and processesManage system security, implement security standards, and respond to system failures or degraded performanceProduce reports on system performance, capacity, availability, and security for senior managementWrite technical documentation and collaborate with teams and partners on ongoing issues and projectsMaintain vendor relationships, oversee outsourced services, and communicate requirements to vendorsManage installation, configuration, integration, and testing of new system components and applicationsMaintain scripts and programs for task automation and functionality enhancementFollow industry best practices and quality assurance standards in system administrationPerform maintenance or upgrades minimizing business/user impact, including on-call dutyConduct analysis of systems and participate in system/project design and engineeringResearch legacy systems to understand and improve performanceConfigure prototypes, deliver products frequently, and manage solution implementation and vendor performance verificationEngage in team activities such as retrospectives, backlog grooming, user story creation, and meetings to support Service and Project ManagersMinimum Qualifications  2+yrs technology support experience2+ years of experience in Administration and implementation of Collaboration ToolsFoster a collaborative and constructive atmosphere, exhibiting optimism in challenging situationsDecompose complex problems into manageable components, offering succinct solutionsExperience with Microsoft suite administration and Collaboration Security frameworks2yrs Experience building efficiency workflows to deliver desirable outcomesSuccessful track record in working on multi-functional team projectsKnowledge of other Collab platforms for systems integration and automation supportExperience using to build and deploy services using: Powershell, PowerBI, APIs, Webservices, Python, C++, JavaScript, Power Platform‍

Want to make an impact and shape the future of design and construction? Autodesk is leading the transformation of the AEC industry, integrating AI technology into our products. We're enhancing our applications with cloud-native capabilities, including data at scale, edge computing, AI-based solutions, and advanced 3D modeling and graphics. This innovation is happening across our flagship products—AutoCAD, Revit, and Construction Cloud—and Forma, our new Industry Cloud. As a Senior Product Manager/Owner for the AEC Solutions group, you will lead the exploration and development of cutting-edge generative AI capabilities for the AEC industry cloud, Forma. You will work with AI Researchers, ML Engineers, and Software Developers. You will define system requirements, set milestones, and lead the exploration of how to apply the latest foundation models and other AI-driven technologies to the AEC domain.  Report: You will report to the Senior AI/ML Development Manager in the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) Solutions Team. You may manage a team of contractors in this role.  Location: We support hybrid work, and you work near our Boston, Massachusetts or Toronto, Canada offices.  Responsibilities Apply your understanding of AEC workflows and AEC data models to develop a comprehensive strategy for the exploration and development of AI systems for AECCollaborate with customers, partners, and internal Experience and Strategy teams to understand pain points and requirements. Translate these insights into target use cases and workflows that address customer needs and prioritize the team's workCommunicate system updates and strategy to partners, including executives and other company leadersWork with a diverse Research and Engineering team to explore AI algorithms, models, and technologies that can empower workflows in the AEC industry cloud, FormaTrack project progress and technical specifications ensuring they continue to be accurate, up-to-date, and easily accessible to teams across the companyBe an Agile Product Owner, maintain an organized backlog with the team, and conduct Scrum ceremoniesMinimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience in software product management roles, with at least 2 years of experience managing commercially-available solutionsBachelor's degree in Architecture or a related field. Understanding of generative AI and machine learning concepts and practicesExperience managing teams with a collaborative and empowering approachExperience engaging with customers, executives, and cross-organizational teamsExperience leading scrum and Agile development processes and methodologies Other Qualifications Familiarity with SVPG or other high-quality product management training programsDeep experience in AI technology and practices, with a focus on how to apply AI in commercialized professional productsPrevious professional work in Architecture or related fields, with a understanding of the AEC industry workflows and customer problemsHave a business degreeIdeal Candidate You have prior experience leading a product through initial research to a commercially available offeringYou understand the AEC customer problem because of previous experience in the AEC industryYou promote scrum and know how to guide teams to achieve their goalsYou are curious and passionate about solving complex problems in new domains You are adaptable, customer-focused, and seek new ways to solve hard problems‍

At Autodesk Construction Solutions, our mission is to help teams meet the world's rapidly expanding building and infrastructure needs, while making construction more predictable, safe and sustainable. Over $100 billion in new construction is managed on our platform every month. From major stadiums to local schools and hospitals, our tools are helping cities grow and communities come together.As a Senior UX Designer, you will collaborate with your Product Management and Engineering partners to support our Build products in the Autodesk Construction Cloud ecosystem. You will help shape the tools that enable our customers to efficiently and safely build the world around us. We're looking for someone who brings human-centered design, will advocate for user needs, and can design strategically in complex problem spaces to deliver compelling user experiences. You will report to the User Experience Manager for Autodesk Construction Solutions.Preference for candidates in Portland, Oregon, Atlanta, Georgia or Toronto, Canada in hybrid/remote or remote environment.Please include resume, portfolio and password when applying.ResponsibilitiesPartner with product managers, engineers, researchers and other designers to define great experiences from initial concept through successful implementationVisualize and prototype intended solutions at various levels of fidelity including high-level wireframes, conceptual designs, design presentations and detailed specificationsCollaborate closely with one or more local or remote Agile Scrum teams, working iteratively to deliver customer valueUse customer insights that come from analytics and customer interactions to help inform business and design decisionsHelp to facilitate and participate in user research, such as interviews and usability testing, to validate designs and make iterative improvementsParticipate in and lead design-thinking exercises to break through organizational silos and collaboratively solve complex design challengesDevelop empathy for customers and advocate for their needsMinimum Qualifications4+ years of related professional experienceQuality portfolio of recent workDistill complex ideas to their essenceDemonstrated experience utilizing a variety of human-centered design methods and best practicesExperience using research and data to inform design decisions, and comfortable defining performance metrics to measure resultsExperience leading user research and familiarity with multiple methodsPartner frequently with multiple partnersSystems thinking – explore how different parts of a complex system fit togetherPreferred QualificationsExperience with Agile software design methodsExperience supporting a complex ecosystem with multiple productsComfortable working on a distributed team and collaborating remotely‍

At ZoomInfo, we encourage creativity, value innovation, demand teamwork, expect accountability and cherish results. We value your take charge, take initiative, get stuff done attitude and will help you unlock your growth potential. One great choice can change everything. Thrive with us at ZoomInfo.  At our ZoomInfo you’ll see that collaboration is second nature, and you’ll be greeted by a team of incredibly smart, talented, and motivated individuals who will help you define your new best. You’ll be presented with opportunities to both personally and professionally develop as you build your career.We believe that our employees love to work and love to work here, and that you will like coming to work because of the sense of accomplishment you get from being a part of what we’re building. You are a fit for our team if you refuse to lose, you seek challenges, and you love to win. We welcome you to join our team of difference makers who are people working with a passion to win together. Twenty Ideas (20i) is the home of passionate people who work together to elevate the web and create meaningful digital experiences for clients across a variety of sectors. The Role:At Logitech we believe that reflecting the diverse world in which we live provides us with the foundation needed to create experiences that enable ALL people to pursue their passions. In this role, you will be empowered to take a hands-on approach to onboarding of the summer intern program by enabling best practices, streamlining processes and supporting operations. You will help to design and implement an intern to graduate hire program and structure a post hire learning experience as graduates transition to full time employees. While working with the C&A team you will leverage skills around project management, communications, event management and community building. In addition, the intern will contribute to diversity and inclusion initiatives including our growing community outreach program, Logitech Cares.This internship opportunity is a great way to develop personal and professional skills in a learn-by-doing environment.                                                                                                                                                                      Your Contribution:Move fast.  Speak up.  Decide and own.  Drive change.  Exceed customer needs.  These are some of the winning behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech. In this role, you will:Lead candidate experience initiatives for intern candidates Maintain candidate dashboards for hiring managers and Leadership awarenessCoordinate on and off-campus intern events such as lunch and learns with executives, community volunteering events and intern project presentations.Evaluate and provide feedback on intern project presentationsEvolve and drive the project readout process (end of internship presentations) Create and manage program communications across intranet, email, social mediaProvide general logistics and departmental support for Intern ProgramCreate and execute a new diversity initiative for Early in Career interns transitioning to full time employment Partner and brainstorm with global LogiCares team ambassadors to create updated program guidelinesPartner with global Community & Advocacy team to implement process improvements and increase program engagement                                                                                                                                                                       Key Qualifications:For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team:Intellectual curiosity, flexibility, and creativityAbility to work independently as well as within a teamStrong interpersonal, written and communication skillsExcellent organizational and leadership skillsMust be able to maintain confidential informationAccuracy and attention to detailIn addition, preferable skills and behaviors include:Demonstrated skill in project managementProficiency and presence in social mediaEducation:Must be currently enrolled Junior or Senior OR recently completed a full-time, academic program at an accredited college or university. Preference for degrees in Business Administration, Human Resources, Organizational Psychology, Humanities, or a closely related field.Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it. As a company, we’re small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen. But we’re big enough in our portfolio, and reach, for those actions to have a global impact. That’s a pretty sweet spot to be in and we’re always striving to keep it that way.This position offers an hourly rate typically between 5.00 hourly - 3.00 hourly commensurate to the level of degree program in which an applicant is actively enrolled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

The Role:As a Global Brand Partnerships Intern you will be responsible for assisting in the development and execution of strategic marketing plans for global brand partnerships, working closely with cross-functional teams across various channels; conducting research and analysis to identify potential brand partnership opportunities that align with Logitech G's objectives and target audience; supporting the negotiation and management of partnership agreements, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines and objectives; collaborating with internal teams, including marketing, product, and sales, to integrate brand partnerships into broader marketing initiatives and campaigns.Your Contribution:Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. These are the behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech. If you're passionate about gaming and marketing and eager to contribute to the success of Logitech G's brand partnerships, we encourage you to apply.Key Qualifications:For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team:Currently enrolled Junior/Senior in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program, preferably in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.Strong interest in gaming, esports, and technology, with a passion for driving innovative marketing initiatives.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.In addition, preferable skills and behaviors include:A fan of Logitech G Existing knowledge of key gaming trends as well as pop culture trendsLogitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it. Why Mozilla?Mozilla Corporation is the non-profit-backed technology company behind pioneering brands like Firefox, the privacy-minded web browser, and Pocket, a service for keeping up with the best articles online. More than 225 million people around the world use its products each month.Along with 60,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation’s staff are driven by our mission to ensure the Internet is a global public resource, open and accessible to all. We design, build and distribute open-source software that enables people to enjoy the internet on their terms.About this team and role:As a Staff Web Designer, you will be responsible for overseeing and executing the design of marketing websites. Your deep understanding of design, design systems, and design-to-code principles will be essential in creating visually stunning and functional web experiences that align with the Mozilla brand and mission. You will work to create and elevate designs on high-traffic websites such as mozilla.org while working with UX and product teams to maintain consistency and quality across our digital platforms.The Marketing Websites Team is a cross-functional team in the marketing organization that manages multiple web properties, including www.mozilla.org. We deliver web and digital experiences that tell the Mozilla story and provide users access to Mozilla products and services. The websites we build and maintain reach millions of users every month. We view our web properties as an extension of the Mozilla mission, and we strive to keep very high standards for security, accessibility, and compatibility.What you'll do: Collaborate with product and UX designers to understand project requirements and objectives.Lead and actively participate in design brainstorming sessions and critiques.Create designs for marketing websites.Ensure all design work adheres to established brand guidelines and design systems.Prepare and document designs, and work with developers to translate designs into code.Ensure designs meet the Mozilla standard for accessibilityManage multiple design projects simultaneously, meeting project timelines and deadlines.Contribute to the development of design and component systems, ensuring scalability and reusability.What you'll bring:Extensive Web Design Experience: A proven track record with several years of experience in web design, particularly focused on marketing websites.Design-to-Code Skills: Proficiency in understanding how designs turn into functional code, and an understanding of how design decisions impact development.Design Systems Knowledge: Familiarity with design systems and the ability to create and maintain design and component libraries for consistency.Creative Problem Solving: Proven ability to creatively solve design challenges and find innovative solutions.Collaboration: Excellent teamwork and communication skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams.Accessibility Advocate: A commitment to inclusive design, ensuring that websites are usable and enjoyable by a wide range of users, including those with disabilities.Bonus Points for…Brand Design: An understanding of branding principles and the ability to incorporate brand identity into web design.Experience with web animations: Strong consideration will be provided to candidates who understand web capabilities for layout, design, and animation, and bring that knowledge and understanding into their designs.A/B Testing: Experience with A/B testing methodologies and how design can help optimize website performance and conversion rates.What you’ll get:Generous More than 225 million people around the world use its products each month.Along with 60,000+ volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozilla Corporation’s staff are driven by our mission to ensure the Internet is a global public resource, open and accessible to all. We design, build and distribute open-source software that enables people to enjoy the internet on their terms.About this team and role:Firefox’s Product Management team is looking for an experienced Principal Product Manager to lead our mobile product strategy and deliver a great mobile browsing experience. This role will work across our product teams to drive a portfolio approach to our mobile product investments across growth, browser essentials, AI and more. You will work with our teams to help identify and build features for existing products as well as help identify new product strategies to help differentiate.What you’ll do:Define mobile product strategy for Firefox Mobile and Firefox Focus on iOS and AndroidClearly set the product/backlog prioritization with a balance of near-term deliverables and longer-term investment in various platforms.Work across several teams to sure we have the right mobile product investments and that they’ll accrue to a great mobile browsing experience.Be a product evangelist and partner closely with business team members and engineering leaders.Effectively communicate strategies and trade-offs up to a range of senior leaders and down to development teams.Synthesize market changes and technology improvements into concrete advancements for our products.What you'll bring: 10+ years of product management experience, including impactful leadership roles on major productsProduct experience with highly trafficked native-mobile products with millions of users.Strong product sense and understanding of user problemsExperience setting a portfolio approach to investments across productsExcellent interpersonal skills, which include active listening and the ability to present complex ideas in concise written and verbal descriptionsExperience working with external partners both in the U.S. and abroad in a product management role.Experience identifying customer and business problems, participating in the product vision, and writing clear/concise requirements with consideration for the end-to-end experience.Experience crafting strategies to differentiate a product in a crowded space.You appreciate integrity and approach business, decision-making, and responsibilities honestly and openly.What you’ll get:Generous performance-based bonus plans to all eligible employees - we share in our success as one teamRich medical, dental, and vision coverageGenerous retirement contributions with 100% immediate vesting (regardless of whether you contribute)Quarterly all-company wellness days where everyone takes a pause togetherCountry specific holidays plus a day off for your birthdayOne-time home office stipendAnnual professional development budgetQuarterly well-being stipendConsiderable paid parental leaveEmployee referral bonus programOther benefits (life/AD&D, disability, EAP, etc. - varies by country)

The Build and Release Engineer works with a team of other Build & Release/Software Operations (SWOPS) Engineers who are together responsible for establishing and maintaining the Software and Firmware build environments supporting multiple Project Teams as well as improving the quality of the work produced by and the productivity of, the Software Engineers, Embedded Software Engineers and SQA Engineers within the Engineering department with a specific focus on the systems, tooling and processes used to do their work. Proficiency with Git and Jenkins are required. Familiarity with Bitbucket, Docker, Linux and knowledge of best-practices for firmware (embedded software) and desktop software continuous integration processes is a plus. How you'll contribute:Design and implement solutions to improve the product quality and/or productivity of the Firmware and Software Engineering department. Ensure that build-automation is efficient, scalable, maintainable, extensible, robust and easy to understand. Help Engineering teams migrate to common flows for development, builds, tests and other tasks. Provide technical leadership on complex projects involving multiple engineers. Evaluate multiple approaches to technical problems and be able to recommend one solution after considering limitations and challenges. Ensure all systems, tools and processes are documented according to standards. Assist in the development of user guides and training documentation for systems, tools and processes used. Plan and perform ongoing routine application maintenance tasks. Evaluate new systems and tools and performs research on best practices. Work with the other departments and vendors to resolve problems and develop solutions. Other duties as assigned. You'll also support with:Researching tools, methodologies, and trends and upgrading existing practices and processes. Developing and implementing automation frameworks, tools, and other scripts or code to assist development efforts. Performing component, contract, integration, performance, stress, and other test at the lower level (a.k.a: “White Box”) testing. A successful candidate should have:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or the equivalent combination of education and experience. 8+ years of experience in large-scale commercial software product development and/or software operations. Expertise in either commercial desktop and/or server application development or commercial embedded software development environments, or both. Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and debugging skills with an aptitude for learning new technologies. Experience designing, developing, testing, and deploying applications/systems using proven or emerging technologies, in a variety of technologies and environments. Demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret complex problems or processes, identify and understand requirements and develop alternate solutions. Experienced with continuous integration flows and tooling (e.g. Jenkins, Ansible) for desktop software and/or embedded software. Proficiency in two or more programming languages including either C# or C++. Proficiency in one or more scripting languages including Python, Bash, Batch or PowerShell. Proficiency with source code management systems and workflows used for version control – experience with Git. Strong grasp of automation tools. Experienced in one or more virtualization and/or containerization technologies. Proven ability to operate across multiple operating systems including Linux and Windows. Demonstrates in-depth knowledge of a broad range of hardware and software products relevant to software operations. Well versed in computer networking, network switch configuration and management, and network protocols. Knowledge of agile development practices such as Scrum or Kanban. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications. Proficient written and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a geographically distributed organization. Work environment:This is an onsite position based in Beaverton, OR.Ability to lift 10 lbs. frequently and up to 50 lbs. periodically. Routine use of standard office equipment.Stand or sit for long periods. What we offer:Medical, Dental, and Vision 3 weeks annual PTO and 9 paid holidays 401(k) + matching Employer-paid base life insurance, short, and long-term disability Health savings accounts (with Biamp contribution) and flexible spending accounts Tuition reimbursement Discretionary profit-sharing Referral bonuses Charitable donation matchingWho is Biamp?We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions. At Apple, our products touch millions of lives every single day with consistency and dependability. Ever wonder how we achieve this? Our System Architecture & Design team is a group of interdisciplinary performance architects, analysts, software engineers, and expert content creation professionals who explore actual production workflows and everyday use cases to enhance and improve customer experiences on current hardware and software. As a Tools Developer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the performance excellence of iPhone/Mac/iPad systems under development. You will also be involved with designing, developing, and maintaining automation and tools to measure and analyze system performance and identify bottlenecks. You will design databases to store data collected across many multi-functional teams and develop visualizations for that data. We are also looking for someone who can support teams with debugging performance and test issues, test code, analyze data, identify bugs, and resolve problems as necessary. If this role sounds fun, we would love to hear from you!Key Qualifications10+ years of software development experience, with a focus on performance optimization.Solid foundation in Computer Science including statistics and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and/or Swift, with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software.Expertise with tools like Xcode and git.Strong database design skills, capable of crafting robust database solutionsProficiency in data analytics and principles of descriptive analysisExperience producing compelling visualizations and dashboards.Excellent communication and presentation skills!DescriptionIn this role, the Tools Developer will assume responsibility for the conception, development, and maintenance of tools and automation essential for analyzing system performance. These will be used for identifying performance bottlenecks, studying how applications utilize our hardware, and for reporting performance while products are being developed. Additionally, the developer will design databases to aggregate performance data sourced from diverse teams within Apple, and create visualizations and reports based on the collected data. You will support cross-functional teams globally by troubleshooting performance issues, triaging OS issues, addressing testing issues, conducting code reviews, and conducting statistical analysis.Education & ExperienceBachelors/Masters of Engineering Degree in Computer Science or relevant field‍

ABOUT OPENSESAMEOpenSesame helps develop the world’s most productive and admired workforces. With the most comprehensive catalog of eLearning courses from the world’s top publishers, we help our customers every step of the way, from finding courses, mapping competencies, increasing utilization, and improving learning and development programs. Not only does OpenSesame have the flexibility of multiple purchasing options, but we also make it simple to use and administer e-learning courses. To learn more, visit www.opensesame.com/about.POSITION OVERVIEWOpenSesame is offering paid summer internship positions for qualified students. Participants in this structured and challenging program will join one of our internal teams to focus on specific projects and advancing initiatives within that department. In addition, the internship participants have the opportunity to work closely with other departments as well as significant interaction with our Founders/Leadership team.PROGRAM OVERVIEWStart date: 18 June 2024 (Tuesday)End date: 16 August 2024 (Friday)The program requires a commitment to work full-time (40 hours/week) for 7 ½ weeks with one week to use as vacation time. Some of your vacation time is paid!Compensation:  $17/hour.Throughout the internship term, all participants will engage in a variety of B2B activities including but not limited to: branding initiatives, exposure to the lead generation process and marketing automation platforms, content creation, sales process, and tech support process. Interns will have the opportunity to work on significant projects within the OpenSesame organization which can contribute to your portfolio of accomplishments for the future.You will work directly with the OpenSesame team of highly creative and hard-charging entrepreneurs. You will also be paired with a mentor from OpenSesame’s team at the beginning of the summer who will partner with you in setting and achieving your personal development goals.As a summer intern at OpenSesame, you will be expected to take training courses, participate in scheduled intern program events such as learning opportunities, networking events, community service, and book club, as well as participate in an intern-led group project. Interns are expected to start work on time and deliver results. If you do not feel that you can meet these requirements, please do not apply.Finance - Keeps the company humming by collecting money from customers, paying our vendors and employees, and generating financial reports for the other departments to help them make decisions. Responsibilities include: Reconciling numbers between various systems and helping streamline accounting processes. Expert Excel skills, technological savvy, understanding of accounting, and how numbers come together for financial statements required.Curation - Maintains the breadth, depth, and quality of the OpenSesame catalog, and selects the right courses to meet our customers’ diverse training needs. Responsibilities include: Evaluating and updating catalog courses, analyzing customer feedback to improve recommendations, improving internal resources and documentation, assisting with customer curation requests, and supporting efforts to improve course quality. Proficiency in Google Sheets or similar spreadsheet software required.Exclusive Content - The OpenSesame Exclusive Content team helps add courses to our catalog that are exclusively available from OpenSesame. We work with new and current OpenSesame publishers to create compelling video-based courses with our innovative eLearning authoring tool. Responsibilities include: supporting the eLearning Production team by helping to prepare videos and other content for publishing, building spreadsheets to capture course data for import, reviewing courses for accuracy, large-scale file management, and writing microcopy. We use Asana to track project tasks and deadlines and spend much of the day in Google Workspace, and our proprietary authoring tool and asset management system.Partnerships - Establishes new channels of businesses by collaborating and building strategic partnerships with both established and innovative businesses across HR and eLearning industries including Learning Management Systems (LMS), system integrators, and consultants. Responsibilities include: developing and supporting partner programs, database management, providing analytical assistance, and improving internal resources and documentation. Tech-savvy, proficiency in Google Sheets/Excel, attention to detail, and knowledge of Salesforce and Pardot, or similar systems, are a plus but not required.Sales - Strives to fully understand potential customers’ training challenges and collaborate with them to outline and execute a solution. Responsibilities include: Analyzing competitor marketing and sales materials for incorporation into internal sales training materials. Knowledge of Salesforce is a plus and Google Apps is required.Sales Development - Is responsible for the early stages of the sales cycle. The team’s objective is to qualify leads through engagement across many channels. Sales Development representatives accomplish this by uncovering unmet needs, understanding their leads, and creating interest for OpenSesame. Responsibilities: Facilitate and optimize sales outreach, analyze strategy and sales development best practices, maintain performance reports, maintain data hygiene , create data visualizations, audit processes and procedures, identify inventive solutions to improve conversion ratios. Sales Operations - Strives to empower sales and customer success teams by creating an ecosystem of scalable, measurable, and repeatable processes, enhancing data quality, and data integrity in all systems used.  Sales Operations works with all aspects of the business. We assist front-line sales Account Executives and Customer Success Managers, front-line Sales Managers, Sales leadership, Order Fulfillment team, Partner team, Business Intelligence team, and the Finance team. Responsibilities include process creation, documentation and communication, error resolution, order management verification, and system migrations, data analysis, weekly and quarterly sales training, and tools for self-reflection and development through data. Sales Enablement - Strives to empower sales and customer success teams by creating an ecosystem of knowledge.  Sales Enablement works to ensure all aspects of customer and partner-facing employees have the skills, knowledge, and resources to be efficient. We assist front-line sales Sales Development Reps, Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, Strategic Partner Managers, and front-line Sales Managers.Responsibilities include process course creation, instructional design, process documentation, new hire onboarding, and communication of new and updated products, processes, and best practices. Customer Success - Strives to fully understand potential customers’ training challenges and collaborate with them to outline and execute a solution. Customer Success, a team within Sales, works directly with existing customers to maintain a continued relationship and help them achieve and expand their training goals. Responsibilities include data analysis for Customer Success projects, drafting and reviewing Customer Success standard operating procedures, updating and maintaining CSM onboarding materials, and data cleanup in CSM tools, such as Salesforce and Gainsight. Knowledge of Salesforce is a plus and Google Apps is required.Marketing - Develops impactful storytelling and branding in campaigns to connect with our target audience, fostering business growth. Responsibilities include collaborating with the product marketing team on launch planning and competitive research, working with the growth team on lead generation strategies, and mastering the skills needed to manage a high-performing website. This position not only allows you to build a portfolio showcasing your impactful projects but also provides the opportunity to learn the dynamics of a closely-knit, effective go-to-market team.  We're looking for the perfect blend of right brain and left brain skills -- communication, analytics, and project management.Product - Develops the OpenSesame product roadmap and delivers high-value products and features for our customers. We define, design, launch, and support the OpenSesame platform for learning administrators, individual learners, and elearning publishers. Using agile software development methodologies, we collaborate with Engineering to make bold new learning ideas into SaaS solutions.Responsibilities include: supporting Product Managers in the successful delivery and launch of products, participating in Agile ceremonies, examining direct user feedback, qualitative research, and quantitative data to create actionable insights, assisting in usability testing, writing requirements and documentation, QA. UI/UX work is possible for interns with prior UI/UX experience and familiarity with design tools.Become the Best Version of YourselfWe want OpenSesame to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve and the world we live in. We know that a variety of perspectives and voices strengthen our ability to deliver the spark of learning to everyone. We hold ourselves accountable to create more diverse, equitable, and inclusive communities through continuous learning, personal growth, and working to support our customers. We welcome you to bring your authentic self to our team and grow beyond your expectations.HOW TO APPLYPlease submit your resume and cover letter including the top three OpenSesame teams you are interested in and why you would succeed in those roles. Applications without a cover will not be considered. If you need examples on how to do this we have courses on resume and cover letter-writing we can share- just reach out! Thank you for applying! ***APPLICATIONS CLOSE 12 April 2024***

OpenSesame's mission is to help develop the world's most productive and admired workforces. We do this by delivering a comprehensive catalog of elearning courses from the world's top publishers. We add value to customers through their entire learning journey.While it appears to most people that we just sell training courses (over 20,000 of them), what we really offer is the opportunity for companies to upgrade the skills of each of their employees.We are at a pivotal time in our growth as we diversify the ways we drive revenue. We've expanded our product offering dramatically, and have a growing network of partners that is developing into a vibrant channel. Our customer base has high satisfaction ratings and there is room to grow our retention even more.www.opensesame.com/about.About the JobWe are seeking a Staff Engineer with experience in Extreme Programming (XP) practices—such as test-driven development, continuous deployment, and evolutionary design—who will improve the skills of engineers across the organization. The ideal candidate will act as a hands-on player-coach who leads by example to teach and mentor the engineers they work with. They will come up to speed quickly in an unfamiliar codebase, identify challenges, and coach teams in addressing them.“Help engineering teams achieve greatness.”Performance Objectives:In your first 90 days, you will be ramping up and working to understand the needs and opportunities of the engineers on your team. You will develop a plan in collaboration with management and begin executing that plan.People:Form rapport with team members (including Product and Design) and engineering leaders.Understand your team’s process and how people work together.Understand engineers’ needs and frustrations.Pair and mob with team members to develop their skills as part of their normal work.Advise engineering managers on how to take advantage of team members’ strengths and how to address their weaknesses.Coordinate efforts with Staff and Principal Engineer peers, managers, and VP Eng.Product:Understand how to use your team’s products.Understand how your team’s work fits into the big picture.Understand your team’s code, design, architecture, and tech stack.Coach team members in collectively owning their work.Coach team members in working incrementally.Process:Collaborate with senior team members to introduce test-driven development, pairing, and teaming/mobbing.Coach team members in improving build processes to achieve zero-friction local development and continuous integration.Coach team members in creating fast, reliable tests based on James Shore’s “Testing Without Mocks” pattern language.Coach team members in incrementally refactoring their code.Within 6 months, your team will be well on its way to fluency in XP practices. You will have established yourself as a trusted expert on your team. You will have made connections with engineers across the organization.People:Teach senior members of the team to act as player-coaches themselves.Collaborate with engineering managers to develop team members’ career opportunities.Work as part of the Staff and Principal Engineer team to identify trends, challenges, and opportunities across all teams.Form relationships with engineers across the organization.Product:Develop team members’ ability to collectively own their work without your active involvement.Develop team members’ ability to work incrementally without your active involvement.Process:Develop team members’ ability to apply XP practices such as TDD, continuous integration, and refactoring without your active involvement.Develop team members’ ability to continuously improve their build and integration processes without your active involvement.Coach team members in applying evolutionary design.Work with engineering leaders to identify and begin applying solutions to large-scale design challenges.By the end of your first year, you will have established yourself as a trusted expert across the organization. You will be working as part of a team of Staff and Principal engineers to improve the skills of engineers organization-wide.Join any team and come up to speed quickly.Move between teams on a regular cadence, working with other Staff and Principal engineers to identify and address cross-team opportunities.Advise Engineering VP and management team on systemic opportunities for improving team skills and processes.Work with peers and team members to incrementally retire legacy technologies and simplify architecture.Tech StackWe currently use the following technologies, with a preference for TypeScript, Node, React, and Terraform:TypeScript / Node.js / ReactPHP / DrupalC# / .NET / AngularPythonGoTerraformDockerAWSCompensation: The base pay for this position depends on experience and generally ranges between $200,000.00 to $220,000.00. At OpenSesame, we offer a comprehensive benefits package to employees upon hire, including professional development, ISOs, health insurance, 401(k) matching, and paid time off.We carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors, relying on market data to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience. We prioritize pay transparency, fairness, and equity to create a positive and inclusive work environment, regularly reviewing our compensation practices to align with our values and goals.Location: This position can be based anywhere in the US. We operate as a remote-first company, and invest in all-company meetings several times a year. Performance Driven: We're looking for self-starters with a track record of delivering excellent results, but we're highly selective about who we hire. We don't focus on typical job requirements, instead, we're interested in specific examples from your past experiences. All positions can be based anywhere in the US, and require up to 15 days of travel per year, with senior management and leadership teams requiring up to 35 days.Equal Employment Opportunity: OpenSesame is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer that values and welcomes diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of various legally protected characteristics, including criminal history, and strive to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. We prioritize safety and security and may use your information accordingly, and you can contact us for assistance or accommodations during the job application process. For more information on our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion initiatives, click here.Pay Transparency: At OpenSesame, we prioritize pay transparency, fairness, and equity to create a positive and inclusive work environment, regularly reviewing our compensation practices to align with our values and goals. We provide competitive and fair compensation to our employees based on their skills, experience, and performance.

Kiva is a global nonprofit, founded in 2005, with a mission to expand financial access and help underserved communities thrive. Kiva unlocks capital for borrowers through crowdfunded loans supported by individuals around the world. Lenders on Kiva can start with as little as $25 to support causes that matter most to them, whether that’s gender equity and support for women, refugees, climate change, small businesses, agriculture, and more. Since our founding, over two million people have invested $1.9 billion in real dreams and real opportunity, spanning more than 90 countries and 4.7 million borrowers.As we work toward our mission, Kiva invests in building and retaining a global team of talent to add to our values-driven and digital-first culture. Our organization is supported by over 700 volunteers and 130+ full time employees dispersed around the world, as well as within team hubs located in San Francisco, Nairobi, Bogota, and Bangkok. Kiva’s team is growing as we pursue exciting new opportunities to scale our impact and create a financially inclusive world.Kiva's values:Impact first - This is why we exist. This is the drumbeat we march to. Every day.Extreme ownership - Own it; you, your relationships, your impact. Insist that others support you and hold you accountable.Be curious and bold - Never stop learning. Question assumptions. Take Risks and dream big.Inclusion. Equity. Diversity. - Without reservation and without caveat. In our hiring, in our workplace and in our impact in the world.Honor and integrity - Do the most right thing in the most right way. Cherish diversity and respect each other.Love and kindness always - Say what you mean. Mean what you say. And don't say it mean. Clarity. Courage. Kindness.Role overview:This position is an integral part of Kiva's Strategic Partnerships team and will be focusing on Kiva’s partnerships program, known as managed lending. Managed lending is a solution for companies (as well as foundations and high-net-worth individuals) with philanthropic goals to donate funds to support Kiva’s mission. The Senior Account Manager will lead the account strategy on employee engagement and cause marketing campaigns for Kiva’s partners (example here). Kiva’s partners leverage technology to deploy their funds efficiently through products like promotional lending credits or matching. This role will focus on providing strong account management that deepens partnerships, ultimately driving more revenue and loan volume through partner campaigns. It will also liaise with Kiva’s marketing and creative teams to create partner materials, implement partner stewardship initiatives, and ensure alignment throughout the campaign planning process. This role will support launching a new product to Kiva’s partners including training, troubleshooting, gathering feedback, and collaborating with Kiva’s product teams.At this time, we can only consider applicants with authorization to work in the United States on a permanent, full-time basis; unfortunately we cannot provide visa sponsorship.Main responsibilities include:Account Management: Serve as the primary account manager for 25-45 larger accounts.Lead account strategy and implementation for larger corporate partners, including throughout the entire lifecycle of the partnership Manage deployment of funds responsible for 40% of loan volume that comes from partner programs Incentivize top-ups, renewals, and referrals from partners through a customized stewardships strategy Develop and support new strategies for expanding and deepening Kiva’s partners through new funding and product opportunities Create detailed implementation plans for employee and customer engagement campaignsWork closely with the assigned relationship manager on all accountsMarketing: Create a revamped partner onboarding experience and partner reengagement materials such as case studies, newsletters, infographics, and training materials  Host webinars/calls to share information with managed accounts and get them up to speed on KivaProduct: Lead product training sessions with partners and develop partner-facing product instructional materials Conduct user surveys/research of customers and end users (i.e. employees of corporate partners) to inform product design and strategyProvide both technical and tactical support to partners during campaign implementationOperations: Proactively identify pain points and areas of improvement in the account management processesWork cross-functionally with marketing, product, data, and other teams to drive a positive customer experience, while establishing deep and meaningful relationships with our partnersRepresent external partners’ needs in internal meetings and set clear expectations cross-functionally of expected outcomes for corporate launchesStrategize with the Director on ways to improve the managed lending program and partner experience  Required qualifications:Minimum 5-7 years experience in fast-paced, growth-oriented organization(s), ideally in account management/partnership, marketing/tech support, with significant experience working directly with corporations 4-5 years experience working in a customer/partnership-centric role that includes building relationships, understanding customer pain points, and how to deliver business outcomes/value 3-4 years experience leading integrated marketing campaigns and working on marketing-related projects such as product marketing, content marketing, and/or partner stewardship Exceptional interpersonal skills and very high EQExcellent verbal and written communication and excellent listening skills; adept at using Salesforce and/or analytic/data tools Must be independent and trustworthy to take on and manage relationships, while also being a team player and communicative with a broad set of stakeholders Bachelor’s degreePreferred qualifications:Track record of building successful employee engagement and/or cause marketing campaigns for corporations and/or track record of upselling and expanding corporate accountsExperience launching a new technical product to customers, including asset development and training plans Deep interest in international development and financial inclusion and capable of speaking articulately about international development and microfinance, including a strong understanding of Kiva’s role and paths for growthExperience living or working internationally; particularly experience living or working in an emerging marketHistory of dedicated volunteer activity and/or commitment to non-profit organizations and international developmentExperience working with a remote team and utilizing Slack and Asana for communications and project management What we offer:An opportunity to improve real lives, solve hard problems, and change the worldFriendly, supportive, and adventurous environment with a team of engaged colleaguesA comprehensive, industry-leading benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, parental leave, professional development, 401k matching, generous PTO, and more.Opportunities to connect with and learn from colleagues and partners around the worldSalary range: $78K - $110K; a final offer will be dependent upon a candidate’s location, skills and experience.

Kindness.Role overview:Join a team of product managers, designers, and technologists who are on a mission to expand financial access to help underserved communities thrive. Building on the success of our crowdlending product, we envision a future in which people come together to invest in others who are improving their communities around the world: women, refugees, small-holder farmers, climate-impacted people, and underserved communities in the US. We are looking for a Senior Director, Product Design who is great at understanding user problems, delivering exceptional product experiences, and has a passion for building new ways to expand financial access.At this time, we can only consider applicants with authorization to work in the United States on a permanent, full-time basis; unfortunately we cannot provide visa sponsorship.Key responsibilities include: As a player-coach, manage and execute multiple projects, effectively manage design resources, and set clear and measurable goals.Define your user experience strategy and evolve our UX processes, testing methods, and design system to deliver exceptional customer experiences.Embrace and continually improve lean UX approaches to deliver the most value to customers as soon as possible.Develop and grow your team’s expertise in product design, user research, interaction design, and visual design.Influence the product roadmap, both short term and long termBuild trust up, down, and across to accelerate your success.Socialize your strategy and value delivered with key stakeholders.Core competencies:Leadership: Ability to inspire and motivate the people around you to deliver positive impacts to the company’s mission and the work environment.
